c74object.name: ears.roll.toreaper~
c74object.digest: Export a bach.roll as a Reaper project
c74object.description: Convert a bach.roll into a Reaper project containing a montage of audio samples

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking opens the exported session in Reaper.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens the exported session in Reaper.

method.name: reset
method.description: If the naming attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeaiff
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writemp3
writeraw
method.digest: Save output as raw file with no header
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writewv

attribute.name: autoxfade
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to automatically crossfade items when they overlap

attribute.name: bufferfiletype
attribute.description: Sets the file type for buffer export, just like for the buffer~ object. Note that this is only relevant if copymedia is on, and if you are using buffers instead of files.

attribute.name: bufferformat
attribute.description:
Sets the bit depth or sample type when exporting buffers, just like for the buffer~ object. Note that this is only relevant if copymedia is on, and if you are using buffers instead of files.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

attribute.name: colorslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the color information (0 = none). It is expected to be a slot of type color, or floatlist, containing at least three items, corresponding to the R, G, B channels (each 0. to 1.)

attribute.name: copymedia
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to copy all files locally in a media folder

attribute.name: fadein
attribute.description: Sets a global amount of fade in for every sample (in units given by the timeunit attribute).

attribute.name: fadeincurve
attribute.description: Sets the curve parameter for the fade in (for fades of type Curve and S-Curve only). The parameters goes from -1 to 1, 0 being linear (default).

attribute.name: fadeintype
attribute.description: Sets the fade in type: 0 = None, 1 = Linear (default), 2 = Sine, 3 = Curve, 4 = S-Curve;

attribute.name: fadeout
attribute.description: Sets a global amount of fade out for every sample (in units given by the timeunit attribute).

attribute.name: fadeoutcurve
attribute.description: Sets the curve parameter for the fade out (for fades of type Curve and S-Curve only). The parameters goes from -1 to 1, 0 being linear (default).

attribute.name: fadeouttype
attribute.description: Sets the fade in type: 0 = None, 1 = Linear (default), 2 = Sine, 3 = Curve, 4 = S-Curve;

attribute.name: fadeslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the fade amount (0 = none). If slots contains a single number, it will be used both for in and out fade; if slot contains two numbers, they will be assigned respectively to fade in and fade out The unit can be defined by the timeunit attribute, although milliseconds should be used preferably, for best CPU performances.

attribute.name: fileslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the file names.

attribute.name: gainslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the gain or gain envelope.

attribute.name: mediafolder
attribute.description: Sets the name of the media folder (only relevant if copymedia is on).

attribute.name: numchannels
attribute.description: Sets the number of channels for each voice (each voice will be converted into a track with that number of channels)

attribute.name: offsetslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the offset from the beginning of the file.

attribute.name: panslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the file names (0 = none).

attribute.name: pitchbase
attribute.description: Sets the pitch (in midicents) corresponding to no transposition (only meaningful if usepitch is on).

attribute.name: reaperheader
attribute.description: Sets the Reaper header (containing version number) in textual form

attribute.name: timestretchslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the timestretch ratio (0 = none).

attribute.name: timeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length). The default is always Milliseconds except for the ears.repeat~, ears.paulstretch~ modules (Relative).

attribute.name: transpositionslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of slots containing the transposition amount, in midicents (0 = none).

attribute.name: usedurations
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to account for note durations while bouncing.

attribute.name: usepitch
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to use the pitch as transposition (also see pitchbase)

attribute.name: velmode
attribute.description: Sets the velocity mode: 0 = ignore; 1 = map velocity to amplitude range (default); 2 = map velocity to decibels range. ranges are defined in velrange

attribute.name: velrange
attribute.description: Sets the mapping range for the velocity. This can be either an amplitude range or a decibels range, depending on velmode.
